com.revature.rms.campus.services

Class BuildingService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.rms.campus.services.BuildingService

  • @Service
public class BuildingService
extends java.lang.Object
    The methods in this service call to methods from the buildingRepository in order to give the basic CRUD features to the application. The methods in this service are custom as a result of TDD. For more information about the testing see BuildingServiceTests.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        @Transactional
public Building save(Building building)
        Save Method: Takes in a building object as the input. The input room object is tested to ensure that it is not null. If the building object is null then it will throw a ResourceNotFoundException. Once the building object passes the test it is then saved or persisted to the database.
        Parameters:
        building -
        Returns:
        The new saved building object

      • findAll

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public java.util.List<Building> findAll()
        findAll method: returns a list of all the building objects in the database.
        Returns:
        a list of all the buildings

      • findById

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public java.util.Optional<Building> findById(int id)
        findById Method: This takes in the id as the input parameter. The input room number is validated to ensure that it is not empty or negative or zero. If the id fails this validation an InvalidInputException is thrown. The building object with the specified building number is retrieved. The building object is tested to ensure that the building object is present. If the building object is not present then a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown. If all these validations are passed, the building object that have the specified building number is returned.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        the building object with the same building id as the input parameter.

      • findByName

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public Building findByName(java.lang.String name)
        findByName Method: This takes in the building name as the input parameter.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the room object with the same room number as the input parameter.

        Returns:

      • update

        @Transactional
public Building update(Building building)
        Update Method: The building object is inputted and changes are saved. The modified object is returned.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Updated/Modified room object

      • delete

        @Transactional
public void delete(int id)
        Delete Method: Building object is found by id and deleted The method takes in the building id. The input is tested to ensure that it is not empty, negative or zero. if the input is empty, negative or zero, an InvalidInputException is thrown. If the building id exist, the object is then deleted
        Parameters:
        id -

      • findByTrainingLeadId

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public Building findByTrainingLeadId(int id)
        findByTrainingLeadId Method: Building object is found by the training lead id The method takes in the training lead id. The input is tested to ensure that it is not empty, negative or zero. if the input is empty, negative or zero, an InvalidInputException is thrown. If the training lead id exist, the building object is returned
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        The building object.

      • getListFromIterator

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> getListFromIterator(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable)
        getListFromIterator Method: Is a custom method that iterates and adds each object to a list of the specified Generic.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Generic of any ObjectType
        Parameters:
        iterable - an Iterable that wants to be converted into an ArrayList
        Returns:
        Returns a List of type T
